review_title: Among top airlines in the world but inefficient. A good starting point to jump into a career in airline business.

cons: Takes a long time to move up the ladder (helps if you know someone higher up) Favoritism Slow to act, not much continuous improvement going on Low salary Old office furniture (HQ) Negativity builds up from receiving complaints from passengers ( unhealthy mental state)

review_title: Best for people who prefer systemized work
pros:
1. Super friendly colleague. 
2. Systemized work
3. Genuine concern for customers
4. Standard Airline benefits package
5. Doesn't exploited staffs i.e. public holiday 5 days work. With decent amount of vacation. I mean compare to some start up that was non existent this company allow pretty decent amount of time off.
6. Superior can guide. You are not left alone. When job gets tough there are superior and team that provides resources to support.
7. High work morale. People are some what take pretty good responsibility of the work and some would even go extra miles for me. It's impressive.
cons:
1. Some staffs are not cooperative.
2. Work can be quite stressful.

pros: - Someday you will have much time after work because finish work early.
cons:
- difficult to get vacation , director may not approve without warning.
- don’t even think to move to other departments, resign is easier.
- always stand by on weekend to answer in “deep details” to management.
- salary increase hundreds bath per year.
- up level position will claim you if it has error from your work though it’s their responsibility. You will be in lawsuit alone in many years without them.
